data.title: Why Employees Stay
data.meta_description: Many companies spend a great amount of time money investigating the causes of employee turnover—for example, through programs of exit interviews. Usually the intent behind such studies is to find out why people leave—the idea being that if a company can identify the reasons for terminations, it can work to hold terminations, and turnover, down. CH

Mr. Hughes is Director of Personnel and Organization Development at Texas Instruments, where he has previously worked in industrial relations, compensation, and other personnel functions. His book, Goal Setting: Key to Individual and Organizational Effectiveness, which was published by the American Management Association in 1965, has received awards from The McKinsey Foundation and the Academy of Management.
